title: Actor Gets Special Award and Shares It with Others
summary: Sally Lindsay, who used to be on a TV show called Coronation Street, got a special award called an MBE from the King. She is 52 years old and is famous for playing a character named Shelley. She said she is very happy and wants to give the award to working class actors. Working class people are those who might not have a lot of money or come from rich families. Only 8% of actors are working class, and Sally hopes more will join in the future. She also helps a charity for sick children. Other people got awards too, like a 101-year-old veteran named Bernard Morgan for volunteering and a council leader named Bev Craig for her work in Manchester. The article talks about how these people are being honored for doing good things.

background_read: This article is about people in north-west England who got special awards from the King in the New Years Honours List. Awards like MBE and OBE are given to people who do good things for their community or country. Sally Lindsay is an actor who wants to help more working class people become actors. Bernard Morgan is a veteran who helps at a war museum, and Bev Craig is a leader in Manchester who helps with city decisions. It shows how different people are honored for their hard work.

WHAT: They received awards like MBE and OBE for their services
WHY: To honor their good work and encourage more working class actors
